issue.summary: A clone set on the P arm of chromosome 21 has multiple false gaps. The same set contains phase-1 clones and possible mouse clones.
issue.status_text: Due to the repetitive nature of this region it is difficult to accurately select clones that match this region to close gaps. It is also difficult to assess if clones overlap.
issue.description: A clone set on the P arm of chromosome 21 has multiple false gaps, which were inserted to facilitate clone entry into the tile path. The same set contains phase-1 clones and possible mouse clones. See PMID: 17895424 for more information. The clones associated with this ticket are (unordered); FP565260.4 AC079801.2 CU633969.4 CU633967.8 FP236315.5 CU633971.4 CU639417.17 CU633906.4 FP236240.8 CU638689.3 FP475955.4 CU634019.4 CU638690.5 CU633904.6 FP236241.3 CU633980.13 FP236243.10 FP671120.18 FP236383.15
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site: Missing copy of segmental duplication
issue.description: The GRCh37 assembly is missing copies of an interchromosomal duplication originating from chr. 4q35.2.
issue.resolution_text: The fully reconstructed copy of this duplication has been added to the chromosome 21 tile path. For more information about the duplication, see HG-1602.

issue.summary: GeneID: 386675 (KRTAP10-7), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_198689.1 aligns to genomic AP001067:86050-87217 and celera assembly component AADB02020358.1:621174-622341 100%, and to NC_000021.7 assembly component AL773602 poorly. Originally described in HG-237. This duplicate Jira issue is being used to manage an update at this gap that is being considered for patch release.
issue.resolution_text: NM_198689.1 aligns to genomic AP001067:86050-87217 and celera assembly component AADB02020358.1:621174-622341 100%, and to NC_000021.7 assembly component AL773602 poorly. Originally described in HG-237. This duplicate Jira issue is being used to manage an update at this gap that is being considered for patch release

issue.summary: Possible misassembly or indel variation in GRCh38 within AF129075.3
issue.status_text: RP11 whole genome shotgun data supports the reference and shows this is variation. Optical mapping shows 2-3kb missing.
issue.description: Analysis of GU266955.1 and GU268177.1 along with alignment of HuRef Chr. 21, suggest there may be ~2,974 bp sequence missing from the reference assembly within component AF129075.3. This may represent variation or an assembly error.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible misassembly or indel variation in GRCh38 within AP001138.3
issue.status_text: Based on optical mapping this looks like a region of variation.
issue.description: Analysis of GU266985.1 along with alignment of HuRef Chr. 21, suggest there may be ~3,168 bp sequence missing from the reference assembly within component AP001138.3. This may represent variation or an assembly error.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Possible misassembly or indel variation in GRCh38 within AP000459.4

issue.summary: Possible misassembly or indel variation in GRCh38 within AP001630.1

issue.description: Analysis of GU268448.1 along with alignment of HuRef Chr. 21, suggest there may be ~2,150 bp sequence missing from the reference assembly within component AP001630.1. This may represent variation or an assembly error.

issue.status_text: The ambiguous bases will be investigated.
issue.description: Ambiguous IUPAC bases in NC_000021.9: 41829696 (M), 41830239 (M) and 41830508 (R) in component AEKP01110574.1.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site
issue.description:
FP565260.4 on 21p in GRCh38 has gene content that matches a region between ~44.1-44.25Mb on chr21q.
The region on 21p is a duplicated region, not all the genes match exactly 100% against the evidence at base level but they share near identical similarity so that they share identical transcript structure and are protein coding.
issue.resolution_text:
FP565260.4 on 21p in GRCh38 has gene content that matches a region between ~44.1-44.25Mb on chr21q.
The region on 21p is a duplicated region, not all the genes match exactly 100% against the evidence at base level but they share near identical similarity so that they share identical transcript structure and are protein coding.

There is a gap in chromosome 21 between components AP006748.1 and AP001612.1
For GRCh38 ABBA01044659.1 and AEKP01110546.1 was added extending into the gap from AP006748
and ABBA01015539.1, AMYH02037863.1 and AEKP01110547.1 from AP001612.1, a gap still remains.

issue.summary: GeneID: 386675 (KRTAP10-7), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_198689.1 aligns to genomic AP001067:86050..87217 and celera assembly component AADB02020358.1:621174..622341(-) 100%, and to NC_000021.7 assembly component AL773602 poorly.
issue.resolution_text: Sequence from AP001067 fixes a 15 nucleotide indel effecting the representation of KRTAP10-7

issue.summary: Issue reported from Web Site: CBS annotation question
issue.description: User reports an annotation of CBS on the short arm of chr. 21 in GRCh38, as opposed to the expected location on 21q.
issue.resolution_text: A CBS-like gene is annotated on the p-arm of GRCh38 (GeneID: LOC102724560). PMID:17895424 describes euchromatic islands on the chr. 21 short arm.

issue.summary: AP000953.2 and AP000959.3 alignment appears incompatible with contig building
issue.description: The alignment between AP000953.2 and AP000959.3 does not appear to be compatible with contig building
issue.resolution_text: Certificate submitted for short join.

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.description: The ticket refers to the gaps between the centromere and the components that flank it on either side.
issue.resolution_text: AP001464.1 contains ~16kb of ALR/Alpha satellite/centromeric repeat on its centromeric end according to repeat masker so this gap will be removed from the tpf.

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.status_text: Currently no clones can be found to cover this gap. The region has been updated with the following WGS contigs, which largely close the gap: ABBA01044659, AEKP01110546, AEKP01110547, AMYH02037863, ABBA01015539.
issue.description: There is a gap in the assembly between components AADD01172788.1 and AADD01172789.1.
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.status_text: Currently no clones can be found to cover this gap
issue.description:
There is a gap in the assembly between components AADD01209098.1 and AADD01172902.1.
Non-HuRef whole genome shotgun AADD01209098.1 and AADD01172902.1 has been removed. The current accessions flanking this gap are AP006740.1 FP885874.7
issue.resolution_text: na

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.description: There is a gap in the assembly in component AP001478.1
issue.resolution_text: Ticket created in error. No problem in this region. Clone ABC8-43003700B23 (RH) cancelled since it is unnecessary; component AP001478.1 contains telomeric sequence.

issue.summary: No alignment between AP001611.2 and AP006747.1
issue.description: No alignment between components AP001611.2 and AP006747.1
issue.resolution_text: Certificate submitted for short join between AP001611.2 and AP006747.1.

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.description: There is a gap in the assembly in component CR382287.7 and AF254982.4
issue.resolution_text: Due to a change in the order of clones in this region this gap has changed and will now be dealt with in HG-1700

issue.summary: Chr.21 Gap Problem
issue.description: There is a gap in the assembly between components AP003900.1 and AP001464.1
issue.resolution_text: Duplicate of HG-499

issue.summary: Should unplaced contig NT_113954 be retained in the assembly?
issue.description: Determine evidence for retaining NT_113954 as an unplaced contig
issue.resolution_text: CR381670 has been added to the TPF for the P arm of chr.21. The tile path that has been used is that as referenced in PMID: 17895424 (Islands of euchromatin-like sequence and expressed polymorphic sequences within the short arm of human chromosome 21, Genome Res. 2007 November; 17(11): 1690-1696).

issue.summary: Tile path problem - Issues with the overlaps either side of AB126081
issue.status_text: 11-SEP-14: ABC8-754722O21 is completed sequence, HTGS phase 3 Accession for ABC8-754722O21: FO681539
issue.description: There are issues with the overlaps either side of AB126081 due to runs of Ns within AB126081. These regions will either require fixing or AB126081 will need to be replaced entirely.

issue.summary: GeneID: 337878 (KRTAP7-1), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NM_181606.1 has a 1 nt deletion at nt 80..81 vs. the reference BAC AP000244.1, which results in a frameshift of the coding region.
issue.resolution_text: HuRef ABBA01057276 has been added to the TPF as a contained clone in AP000244 to represent the missing base.

issue.summary: PCR product AP006748 needs to be included in reference
issue.description: PCR product AP006748 needs to be included in reference
issue.resolution_text: PCR product AP006748 has been included in the reference.

issue.summary: Localization of AF254982
issue.description: Sequences defining GeneID 390530 currently mapped to chr15 align best to AF254982 mapped to chr21.
issue.resolution_text: current evidence indicates AF254982.4 belongs on chr21 near the centromere

issue.summary: incorrect correction of genomic deletion in coding exon of C21orf62
issue.description: incorrect correction of a more or less unsupported genomic deletion of a single "A" in AP000280.2 in coding exon of C21orf62.
issue.resolution_text: Mini-contig KF459715.1 addresses this base issue and has been added to the reference tile path for GRCh38

issue.summary: GeneID: 150142 (C21orf121), poor quality (includes component misassembly)
issue.description: NR_027273.1 aligns to GRCh37 with GT-AC splice sites which are unlikely to be functional. The 'C' at NC_000021.8:43,444,414 corresponds to rs220219. The C is found in GRCh37, Celera, and HuRef, but population data for rs220219 shows a bias towards G in all populations, making a consensus AG acceptor site.
issue.resolution_text: Mini-contig KF495992.2 has been constructed to update rs220219 (C->G). This has been added to the TPF and the consensus splice sites will be present in GRCh38.
